content: It's already going on for a week, but should we join this years Hacktoberfest? We didn't get much spam in the past years, so I wouldn't be concerned about that. The number of PRs might go up though.
Oh, I just noticed, that we already participate. :big_smile:
Does anyone know if they count approved pull requests merged my @bors as maintainer contributions? I accepted one and merged it but it didn't seem to count :thinking: :upside_down:
Is there even something like a "maintainer contribution"? I think you have to create the PRs yourself.
Yes, they've just added it this year :upside_down:
I plan to start coding again soon, so either way is fine with me :)
I'll also use this as a motivation to submit PRs to Clippy myself more this month instead of just reviewing :)

@flip1995 yeah i added the tag, people tend to have bad experiences with hacktoberfest but clippy has a really healthy mentorship ecosystem so it always works out well for us. and hacktoberfest has taken a lot of moves to prevent spam these years
@xFrednet yes, contributions that get merged (or even an approving review from maintainers) are valid, as long as they are to participating repos. so any PRs to clippy that merge are fine
heh i think i didn't tag myself as a maintainer on the website
i guess they just don't have a dashboard for it
Alright 2 Clippy PRs open and I started working on clippy#7765 :rocket: I forgot how fun it is to actually fix stuff in Clippy, instead of just syncing and reviewing :sweat_smile:
yeah clippy is a _really_ fun codebase to hack on. i haven't made PRs in a while but when i do i always enjoy it

I've always had the feeling that I didn't know the rustc api well enough and that that was slowing me down a lot...
But imposter syndrome probably also plays a role there... :sweat:
